item.title: Hacker News Top Stories: Thursday, August 29, 2024 at 9:15 PM UTC
item.description:
1. Bypassing airport security via SQL injection (817 points | 193 comments)
2. Elasticsearch is open source, again (72 points | 36 comments)
3. Launch HN: CodeViz (YC S24) – Visual maps of your codebase in VS Code (69 points | 23 comments)
4. Chrome is entrenching third-party cookies that will mislead users (199 points | 91 comments)
5. Raspberry Pi Pico does line rate 100M Ethernet (135 points | 22 comments)
6. Poly (YC S22) is hiring Rust experts in SF to build "Arc browser for files" ( | hide)
7. Dawn of a new era in Search: Balancing innovation, competition, and public good (150 points | 35 comments)
8. Can solar costs keep shrinking? (157 points | 257 comments)
9. Show HN: A discovery-focused search engine for Hacker News (76 points | 14 comments)
10. Judge rules $400M algorithmic system illegally denied Medicaid benefits (186 points | 52 comments)
11. Launch HN: Patchwork (YC S24) – Automatically add structured logs to your code (62 points | 19 comments)
12. Judges rule Big Tech's free ride on Section 230 is over (234 points | 264 comments)
13. OpenAI is good at unminifying code (774 points | 268 comments)
14. All text in Brooklyn (125 points | 48 comments)
15. How I learned to stop worrying and love userspace networking (117 points | 24 comments)
16. Show HN: An open-source, local-first Webflow for your own app (133 points | 41 comments)
17. OpenVMS x86_64 at the Edge (7 points | 1 comment)
18. Show HN: Homemade automated solar concentrator (234 points | 60 comments)
19. Floating points between zero and one (58 points | 43 comments)
20. Shufflecake: Plausible deniability for hidden filesystems on Linux (2023) (57 points | 16 comments)
21. Smart mask for exhaled breath condensate harvesting and analysis (7 points | discuss)
22. Rescuing songs that record labels forgot existed (136 points | 18 comments)
23. Web Design Museum (137 points | 30 comments)
24. Air Con: $1697 for an on/off switch (1699 points | 438 comments)
25. GNU Screen 5.0 Released (177 points | 93 comments)
26. Memos: stick private notes on your email (64 points | 46 comments)
27. What Life Means to Einstein (1929) [pdf] (94 points | 45 comments)
28. Two Dots Too Many (2008) (70 points | 33 comments)
29. Show HN: turn videos into ASCII art (open source, js+canvas) (91 points | 22 comments)
30. How Intel Missed the iPhone: The XScale Era (80 points | 79 comments)
item.guid: Hacker News Top Stories: Thursday, August 29, 2024 at 9:15 PM UTC
